info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire and southeastern Columbia Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Philmont, or 10 miles west of Great Barrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Copake, Austerlitz, Housatonic, Stockbridge, Hillsdale, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Alford, Mahkeenac Heights, Craryville, Newsboy Statue, Glendale, Tanglewood, North Hillsdale, Williamsville, Martindale, Green River and North Egremont. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
